segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, This segment specifies a message code which indicates whether this message contains policy status information, policy activity information or both.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the reporting period ending date.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the default currency and its scaling factor for monetary amounts in this message.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person(s) or department(s), and their function(s), to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments containing policy, insured, coverage or relationship data. Depending on the contents of this parent segment group, the segment group can also contain a policy segment group, insured segment group or coverage segment group.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, This indicator specifies a code which indicates whether this group is a policy, insured, coverage or relationship group.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment identifying references conditional upon the general indicator above:
- for a policy group: the policy number and case identifier.
- for an insured group: a unique number identifying each of the insureds and optionally an original policy number from which a continuation resulted.
- for a coverage group: a unique number identifying each of the coverages on a policy, the policy form number, the plan code and the rate band indicator.
- for a relationship group: the unique number identifying the insured and the unique number identifying the coverage applied to that insured. This allows insured groups and coverage groups to be related to each other.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation:
ATT, A segment providing attributes conditional upon the general indicator above:
- for a policy group: the policy activity currently being reported
- for an insured group: the insured's gender
- for a coverage group: the attributes of the coverage are described.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying general dates or durations related to the policy, the insured or the coverage.
- for a policy group: the transaction effective date
- for an insured group: the insured's birth date and the mortality rating expiry date
- for a coverage group: dates associated with the coverage are defined.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments in which is detailed policy information.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment indicating if the policy is single life or joint life.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving location information for the place of issue and the owner place of residence.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment providing the transaction sequence number. This segment is required when the BGM indicates that the message contains transaction activity.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the default currency and its multiplying factor for all monetary amounts in this policy.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying the names of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the message. Identification of the direct writing company of this policy and any intermediary, third party administrator, of this policy. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified; e.g. if the direct writer and intermediary names are known to the sender and receiver, then only the coded identification is required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments in which is detailed insured information.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the mortality or morbidity rating of the insured. The underwriting table rating assigned to the insured is generally expressed as a percentage where 100% is standard. Any rating scheme, however, can be used with agreement between the sending and receiving companies.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying the name and universal identifier of the insured.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving the location of the insured's place of residence.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments in which is detailed coverage information.

segment.name: Insurance cover description
segment.documentation: ICD, A segment giving insurance cover risk type.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the mortality or morbidity rating, the Cost of Living Adjustment benefit for disability income riders and mortgage interest rate associated with mortgage plans.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment providing the occupation class of the insured for purposes of this coverage as defined by the issuing company (required for disability income coverages).

segment.name: Agreement identification
segment.documentation: AGR, This segment will be used to provide both the reinsurer's and the cedent's treaty identification for this coverage.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, This segment identifies the insured's place of residence for this coverage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments in which is detailed monetary amounts and their purpose for the coverage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment specifying the purpose of the monetary amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments which details flat extra premiums associated with this coverage.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate at which the flat extra premium is calculated per unit.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment specifying the basis for calculating the flat extra premium e.g. face or net amount at risk.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the duration for charging the additional flat extra premium.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments in which is detailed monetary amounts and their purpose for the flat extra premium.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment specifying the purpose of the monetary amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments which details the valuations associated with this coverage.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment providing the purpose of the valuation e.g. United States Tax, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, etc.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying the standard mortality or morbidity table, the standard function, the standard method and substandard method used in calculating this reserve.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the standard interest rate used in calculating reserves for this coverage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments in which is detailed monetary amounts and their purpose for the valuations.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment specifying the purpose of the monetary amount.
